title: Man Utd injury news: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer unsure whether Anthony Martial, Aaron Wan-Bissaka and Jesse Lingard will be fit to face Liverpool
text:
Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has a number of injury problems (Picture: Getty)

Manchester United boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has admitted he will wait until Sunday before making a decision over his starting XI against Liverpool.

Liverpool are bidding to equal Manchester City’s Premier League record of 18 wins on the bounce with victory at the Theatre of Dreams.

The Norwegian claimed earlier this week that both David De Gea and Paul Pogba would both miss the clash but the Spaniard’s groin injury is not as bad as first feared.

Luke Shaw and Anthony Martial had both been expected to be fit but the left-back appears to have lost his battle, while the Frenchman is yet to prove his fitness.

Martial has missed the last six weeks of action (Picture: Getty)

Aaron Wan-Bissaka has missed the last two games through illness and Solskjaer admitted today that he was unable to provide ‘positive’ news about his injured players.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Of course I would like to tell you positive news hopefully we’ll see on Sunday who’s come through the last two sessions because there are players that just started training on the verge of coming back so can’t really say,’ said Solskjaer.

Asked specifically about De Gea, Solskjaer replied: ‘Don’t expect him to play but wasn’t as bad as feared, when I saw the game I thought that’s him out until next international break but it’s not as bad as feared.’

United could finish the weekend in the relegation zone if results go against them and Solskjaer will be desperate for a result against their arch rivals.

The Red Devils’ have scored just three goals in their last five matches but the Norwegian says injuries have played a part in that poor run.

‘Of course when you lose the majority of front creativity that we started with you’re gonna struggle to create as many chances as you like,’ said Solskjaer.

‘You can’t carve that opening, the pressing up high has been very good, attitude, desire, has been very good but not enough chances created, not taken.

‘Sometimes that’s confidence, human nature, you say players missing chances they won’t normally miss but it’s up to us to get the ball between the posts, that goal never misses.’

description: Manchester United boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has admitted he will wait until Sunday before making a decision over his starting XI against Liverpool. Liverpool are bidding to equal Manchester City's...
